subject: Wages and Salaries
Baseball
lead_paragraph: Outfielder Alex Rios avoided salary arbitration by agreeing to a one-year, $4.8 million contract with the Toronto Blue Jays. Rios has career highs with 24 home runs and 85 runs batted in last season while batting .297. Rios had asked for $5.65 million and the Blue Jays countered at $4.5 million. Rios, 26, made $2,535,000 last year.
